intro: Mitracarpus villosus var. glabrior, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its showy, yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks.
